You’ve been in your room for hours. Looking at the newest anime and having heated debates with Hero Aca.’s version of Reddit. You won’t call this a life. A stay at home life. You can’t even keep a job. And you had such a bright future too. Till you found your quirk never manifested. Somehow, it broke your spirit. It’s not like you were aiming to be a Hero. Not really....... but it certainty made you feel like an outcast. Your parents did try to be supportive but you couldn’t help but imagine to worst of yourself. Now you lock yourself in your room, not stepping out unless it’s for school or food. (Is this really the case or is it a lie? Your choice.)

You look over the email sent by your old friend. The one who supported you always. Always sneaking dirty magazines to you, though you do have the internet. Which you had tried telling your friend but they won’t give up trying to find other ways to connect with you, always coming over to visit. This person hasn’t been seeing you as much now, with everything that has been going on at U.A. However, that doesn’t stop this person from emailing you.

This newest email is an ad for U.A.’s Culture festival. Why would your friend send you this? You can only assume your friend is asking you to come.

You look over your dark room. It is so messy. Sniffing yourself, you realize you might need to take a shower. You look back at the email. After thinking about it for a bit, you message back.

‘Alright, just for you. See you tomorrow.’ You smile when you sent that. At least you know you still have someone you can still count on.

You turn off the computer and head off to bed. It’s 3:00 in the morning. Kinda early for you.

The next day, your alarm went off and you flop yourself out of bed. 7:00am? Too early. You were about to head off to bed till you remember your promise. Groan. No backing out now. You took a shower and put on the nicest clothes you have. U.A. is across the city. You think. You should have checked for directions last night but you are already out the door. You can always ask someone for directions. You actually started to feel a bit excited to spend time with your friend.

After walking 5 blocks into the city, you realize you are lost. Checking the time, it’s 7:35. The Cultural Festival starts at 8:00, right? You start quickening your pace, looking at your phone to keep an eye on the time.

Out of no where, you bumped into someone. You were taken aback and fell on your butt. “Ouch.” You look up and see...

“Ah!” You cried out. Cold!

You back away from the person you had grazed in your mad dash. On your left arm, the temperature dropped below freezing. You grab your left arm and rubbed it to keep it warm.

“Oh. I’m sorry.” The person said with concern. It sounded like a boy. “Wait, don’t rub. It isn’t going to help. Your arm is going to get a frost bite if it isn’t treated.” The boy you had touch took a heat pad from his left pocket and handed it to you. “Here.”

“T-thanks.” You grab the heat pad and placed it on your arm. It steadily began to warm you.

You look up to Mr. Freezy pants and... see a handsome boy. His hair is evenly split between two colors: white on his right-side and red on his left. They... look pretty cool. You randomly thought how cool your hair could be if it was half an half like that. https://images.app.goo.gl/65U7NpYgq79FXR...

You spot the burn mark on his left eye, with a beautiful turquoise color. Wait...

“I know you! You’re Shoto Todoroki! I saw you at the sport festival!” You exclaimed. You can’t believe you ran into a U.A. elite.

Shoto’s face remained calm. “I’m surprise people still talk about it.”

You watched the Sport Festival with your parents months back. It’s a big deal in your family, like the Super Bowl for families of old. It was enjoyable to watch but the highlight was the tournament. There was a lot a cool action and different quirks clashing together, but the best part was when Shoto faced off against that green hair boy. Such power. It may have been your imagination but it felt like you could feel the shock wave from your house.

“Of course! I never seen something so grand in my life!” You squeal. Here you are, standing in front of someone famous. It feels surreal. You don’t even notice your arm turning back to it’s normal color.

But Shoto seemed impatient. “Well, I’m glad my ice didn’t hurt you too bad. I need to be off. I have important business to attend to. I hope you have a pleasant day.” With that rush send off, Shoto turned and begin to walk away.

“W-wait...” You began following him. You still have time to make it to the Culture Festival. Perhaps you can get a autograph and show it to your friend.

11521.content:
“Oh, hello, Yaoyorozu. My name is Kibo Hinata,” you say before registering her name in your mind “oh, you were are the U.S.J. when it was attacked.” Momo looks down in remembrance with a look of fear. You smack yourself mentally for being so blunt. “I’m sorry you probably don’t want to be recognized for that. I just realized I knew your name and blurted out the correlation.”

“That’s alright, it’s been happening quite often so I’m getting used to it,” she replies as she starts walking. You follow slightly behind and to the left of the U.A. student.

Not wanting to let the awkwardness to last you say, “so you participated in the festival. I hear that hero agencies use the event to spot talent.”

“They do. It’s a great opportunity for heroes in training to get noticed. Being spotted in the tournament can allow students to make a presence in the pro world, even if only a tiny one,” Momo responds.

“You do well?”

“I have in fact. I’m in the final round,” she says with pride.

“Is there a dress code for the festival or...”

“The festival is set up so the first two rounds will narrow down the number of participants. Before the third and final challenge there is a field day for those who lost. This allows for some fun for students who were dropped from the competition and gives them another chance to show off their quirks. Apparently it is a tradition that the girls not participating dress in cheer outfits for the event” she explains while swaying her hips hypnotically. Being a hormonal 15 year old her listen as best you can while trying not to stare.

“I see,” you say as a breeze causes her skirt to ruffle. Averting your eyes as so not to be called a perv, you take the chance to adjust your pants.

After some more walking you see stalls and a large arena ahead. You assume this is the place and speed up to walk beside your guide.

“Impressive, I guess the school makes plenty of money from these events. Most my school gets is a bake sale for the football team,” you offer mindlessly.

“Yes, I suppose the school is quite profitable,” Momo concludes with an off tone.

Panicked you add, “I didn’t mean that in a judgmental way. I’m happy that a school that trains our future defenders has plenty of money.”

“Oh. Well, one can’t put a price on knowledge,” Yaoyorozu asserts.

The two of you walk to an entrance to the arena and Momo stops. “This is where we part ways. It was nice to meet you Kibo Hinata.”

“As for you Momo Yaoyorozu,” you say as you extend your hand for a handshake.

With a smile, she accepts your hand. You blush at her quiet beauty and get lost in the moment. Feeling a tightening in your trousers, your mind wanders. By accident your quirk activates and the girl slowly expands. Only slightly in the bust and hips before you realize what you’re doing and release her.

“Well, goodbye,” she says and walks away. You attempt to ask her to wait to explain and reverse what you’ve done, but shame overwhelms you and your throat catches. Hearing the noise she turns around to see you with your hand raised and smiles before waving and continues walking. A deep crimson adorns your face and neck. You shove your hands in your pocket before trudging away.

1152121.content:
(Writing in 3rd person is easier for me. I apologize for the shift from previous chapters.)

Kibo tucked his chin into the high color of his grey jacket while his hands rested deep in its pockets. His face was still burning as he entered the tunnel that lead to the seats. He felt so bad. He'd been doing so well in controlling his quirk for the last few years, but the second he meets a pretty girl his looses control. He stopped at the foot of the stairs and banged his head against the wall.

This wasn't the first time he'd altered peoples sizes. All through out junior high he'd augmented the proportions of his classmates and teachers, each time by accident. Kibo's erection was still raging from the experience. He hit his head on the wall again. "Go away dammit," he cursed. It didn't help that he was a macrophiliac. Whether this was a result of his quirk or just a cruel coincident he didn't know. A text pulled his attention. Grabbing his phone, he saw he had a text from his friend.

Where are you?

With a sigh he responded.

In the arena.

Cool, I'm in section D. Row 45.

At this point all Kibo wanted to do was go home, but he made a promise that he'd come. He was already late so the least he could do was watch the final round. He made his way up the stairs and maneuvered carefully through the crowd. As he searched for a sign from his friend heard the announcer declare the beginning of the recreational games. He turned to see the cheerleaders dancing on the sidelines before the announcer pointed out the female students of class 1A. When he saw Momo his blush came back with a vengeance. He pulled the collar of his jacket up over his cheeks and rushed up the stairs. A loud whistle stopped him. Looking to his left he saw his friend waving at him. Kibo tiptoed passed the seated audience members to reach his seat.

"Didn't the police tell you to stop using your quirk in public?" Kibo asked as he sat down.

"Like they'll even know I used it here," he replied.

Hayden Goto: His quirk Whistle. The volume and pitch of his whistle can rival that of a fog horn.

"I think the people around you would complain about their bleeding ears."

"Oh come on. It wasn't that loud. Not like that time at Kyda's house," Hayden smiled.

"Are you sure bringing up the time you shattered all the windows in a house is a good way of changing my mind?"

"Don't be such a buzz kill. You know, you where a lot more fun in middle school," he said causing Kibo to grimace. With a shoving of Kibo's shoulder Hayden said, "dude. Chill out. It was the past. You need to get over it and look at the here and know. For example." He gestured toward the game that was currently being played. Kibo watched and tried to put his shame out of his head.

The day went on and Kibo actually found himself enjoying himself. He and Hayden laughed and cheered as the recreational section of the festival, then things moved onto the fourth and final part of the festival. A bracket tournament that would decide the winner. It was enjoyable as it started, save for the part where he and hayden where nearly frozen solid by Shoto Todaroki. It wasn't until the sixth match that Kibo actually cared what was going on. Fumikage Tokoyami vs Momo Yaoyorozu. Watching intently, Kibo noticed that Momo's uniform didn't zip up all the way. That was his fault. As soon as the match began Tokoyami unleashed a series of quick strikes. All Momo could do was create a shield to attempt to stay in the match, but it was ultimately fruitless. Momo looked so distraught.

"Was that my fault. She looked like she was distracted at the beginning of the match, and she looked like she was off balance. She lost because of me," Kibo thought as he clenched his fists. He quickly stood up and headed for the stairs.

"Bathroom?" Hayden asked to Kibo's back. Taking the stairs two steps at a time, Kibo ran down the steps before grabbing the railing and using it as a pivot to swing around a corner. He then began to run around wildly looking for the waiting area for the combatants. After much searching for what felt like an eternity Kibo eventually found Momo walking slowly toward a door.

"Yaoyorozu!" he shouted. She looked up to see him as he fell to his knees, slammed his head on the ground and slid to a stop in front of her. "I'm so sorry,"

"Hinata?" she questioned.

"I'm so sorry. It's my fault that you lose. My quirk is Size Change. My vulgar mind caused your breasts and hips to grow. It threw you off and caused you to lose. There is no excuse for this deviant act. Especially after you were so kind to help me. I submit to you. Punish me as you wish. Call the police, tell the pro heroes, beat my worthless body. I deserve it," Kibo sobbed on the ground.

"Kibo," Momo said as she looked down at her chest. She hadn't even noticed. Looking down at the wreck of a boy before her,, Yaoyorozu knelt down and put a hand on his back. "It wasn't your fault Kibo. Tokoyami overwhelmed me. Your augmentations did nothing to change the results of my match," she reassured.

"Even so. I defiled your body," he stated.

"You've done no such things. If anything you helped me in my match," she assured.

"What?' Kibo asked as he looked up at her.

"My quirk uses the lipids stored in my body to fuel my creations. By increasing my bust, you increased the stores I had available," she continued.

"I still..." Kibo was interupted by Momo.

"You admitted to the act and are obviously repentant, so I forgive you. Now please forgive yourself," she pleaded and held out a hand to help him up. Kibo took it and rose to her feet. "Your quirk isn't activated by touch is it?"

"No. I have to activate it but I have to have physical contact with a person if I'm to affect them, but I sometimes have trouble controlling it when it comes to others," he explained while looking at his hand.

"I see, so what caused you to activate your quirk?" she questioned. Kibo blushed again at the question and averted his gaze.

"I see," she said with a subtly smile "well then. I can think of only one thing to do." Kibo looked up at her. "I will have to help you gain control of your quirk. Hand me your phone." Kibo did as told and Momo took it before imputing numbers. "This is my number. After this festival is over, I will contact you and work out a training schedule for you."

Momo handed the phone back and looked at Kibo who stood dumbfounded. "I..." he stammered.

"I will talk to you later Kibo Hinata," she informed before turning around and walking away.

"What?"

The girl reached into her skirt and pulled out an I.D., showing it to you. You look over the I.D. and it reads, “Yui Kodai, Class 1B. U.A. Highschool.”

“Oh, you are an U.A. student?” Kodai nods.

Oh! So that’s why the uniform looks familiar. She is an U.A. student. Mentioning the Culture Festival must have attracted her attention. Wait, maybe she knows the way to U.A. since you are a bit lost.

“Er, I’m sorry to bother you, but can you help me find the way to U.A.? I’m a bit lost.” There was a momentary pause before Kodai nods her head.

You feel relieved. Wandering the city till you find the school wasn’t a well thought plan to begin with. “Thank you! My name is... Nice to meet you.”
1551.title: Yui Kodai

choices: They make it to the clinic
15511.content:
"Marino Mitsuko.", Mitsuko said. He was wearing black combat boots, blue jeans that were a little long, a belt with fist-shaped buckle, a long red t-shirt, and a leather jacket; topped off with brown messy hair.

"So, shall we go, Kodai?", Mitsuko asked. Kodai nodded, and took his hand and started walking.

Kodai, Kodai. It doesn’t sound right on the tongue. Mitsuko would love to address Kodai by her given name, Yui. Her family name seems a bit off on his tongue but it would be weird to address a stranger by their given name. He would have to be close to her.

Mitsuko’s name talk got cut off and he instead started blushing heavily, as her hand felt very nice. "Not much of a talker, are you?", he asked her. Kodai has not said a word since they met and she continues to stay silent as they walk through the city.

“...”, Kodai just shrugged, and continues to hold his hand.

"Your hand is soft.", Mitsuko told her. Kodai stopped walking, and he could see her face turning red.

"Is something wrong?", He asked. Have they arrived at U.A. or something?

"I just don't get complimented that often", She said. Her voice was barely audible but Mitsuko could still hear her.

"Aha, she speaks!", Mitsuko said.

Kodai frown, blushing embarrassment, and went silent. She tugged on his hand and they continued walking. She didn’t seem to take the compliment well. Maybe... she thinks she doesn’t deserve it. But why?

"Ah, sorry about that. I was teasing.”, Mitsoku apologized. Kodai kept walking, heading further and further away from people.

Mitsoku isn’t liking this awakened silence. He feels like he should say something. “I’m surprise. You and the U.A.’s hero students are all amazing. As long as you are working to make a difference, you should be proud of yourself.” Mitsoku said. If he had a quirk, he would also be striving to be a hero.

Kodai stops walking. He hears a faint mumbling coming from her. They had stopped in a less crowded area and there are fewer shops that Mitsoku recognize here.

Suddenly, Kodai firmly grabs a hold of his hand and pulls him away from the street. She dragged him into an alleyway; and forcing Mitsoku against a wall, and gazed fiercely into his eyes.

"Do you know what you just did?", She asked in a neutral tone.

"Um...", Mitsoku wasn’t really sure what prompted this reaction.

"You made me feel better about what I've done so far, more than anyone else has; even me. Thank you!", Kodai said.

That was when she threw her arms over him and forced her lips on Mitsoku, having him react in surprise by her sudden. He is completely confused right but return her embraced in a kiss.

"Let's have a proper introduction. My name is Yui Kodai of class 1B. My quirk is Size; I can change my size. And you?", she asked. She seems to be a lot more talkative then before.

"Marino Mitsuko, I have no quirk. But what was...", that kiss, Mitsoku was about ask.

"You don't? So you have the problem with the toe joint?", She asked. Her neutral expression seem slightly worried.

"No, I just haven't had my quirk show up. Late bloomer, you know.", Mitsoku said, joking poorly to lighten the mood.

Still concern about Mitsoku being quirkless, she asked, "Did you get an evaluation?"

"No, my parents said to wait for something to happen; then get the evaluation. At the time, I was ok with it but now I really don’t know why didn’t do an evaluation.", Mitsoku said. Wait, why are we talking about whether I have my quirk or not? What about that kiss?

"That's not how it should be.” Kodai said. She is standing against Mitsoku, her body pressing against his. Her neutral face doesn’t match what she is saying.

“... How about you come with me? There should be an evaluation clinic near the train station.", She said. She is being very insistent.

"But the festival...", Mitsoku said. He still wants to join his friend and talk about this kiss he got.

"Don't worry. The festival starts in an hour and the clinic is 10 minutes by walking, faster if we jog. Lets go!", Kodai grabbed his hand and dragged him along, pulling a confused Mitsoku.
15511.title: Marino Mitsuko (MC Boy)

155332.content:
… a pair of sparkling blue eyes looking down at you. “Hey, hey!” The owner of those beautiful eyes asked. “Are you okay?”

Your mouth fumbled open, but you couldn’t find any words to say. The girl standing over you is simply stunning. Her hair was a waterfall of the prettiest periwinkle, reaching all the way down to her knees. Her fair skin positively seeped with life and energy, with not a single blemish to found anywhere. Her face was the perfect mix of cute and attractive, made even more alluring by the enchanting pools of her eyes. Down from there, your eyes caught sight of a plump pair of breasts that threatened to burst free from her uniform at any moment. Wow. Could they be the biggest you've ever... No, wait... Does Mt. Lady count or-

You were snapped from your trance by a finger jabbing into your forehead. “Hey, hey!” The girl said again. Now she was kneeling down right in front of you. She seemed utterly oblivious to the way her bent legs lifted up her skirt, letting you catch just the faintest glimpse of baby blue panties. “I said: “Are you okay?””

Burning the reddest red, you throw her eyes to the ground. “Y-Yeah. I’m fine.” You say, and push yourself to your feet. The girl rises with you, coming to stand about half a foot shorter than you. Her sparkling eyes drilling into you was starting to make you nervous. “S-Sorry about bumping to you like that. I was lost and wasn’t paying attention to where-”

“It’s fine, it’s fine!” The girl interrupts with a dismissive wave, before pressing a finger into her cheek. “Are you heading to the Cultural Festival?”

Awkwardly, you nod. A gigantic smile springs to life on the girl’s face.

“Same! Well, actually, I came from there, but I’m going back now!” She sprang forward, almost making you step back as her face stopped only a few inches away from yours. “I can take you there! Name’s Nejire Hado! What’s yours, what’s your?”

Honestly, you would find the girl’s seemingly endless curiosity intimidating if she wasn’t so adorable and charming. You swallow down the nervous lump in your throat.

“W-Well, Hado-chan, I'm…”

info.brief_description: An interactive story for you to expand on. Let’s go play with those “Heroes!”
info.description:
Finally! A quirk of your own! Perhaps you have what it takes to be a Hero! Or, feeling a little angry at the world, perhaps you should be a villain. Do what you want!

Well, I’m betting you would do that anyway. Let’s be honest, you came here for the girls and the boys to be in... 18+ situations, you naughty pervert. Though, I’m personally here for the girls. Oops! Welp, I gave away my preference. Well... Go forth! Carve your destiny!

As for you, I had the gender ambiguous in the first page. You can decide what the gender is for the main character when continuing on with the story. I did this so the protagonist doesn’t have to be stuck as a boy right from the get go. But the quirk has to stay the same. Body manipulation. Pretty OP, right?

Sadly, I do have rules for you. Just so we can keep a... “direction” for this interactive story. Fair is fair.

Rules:

1. The setting of the story must take place in the world of Hero Aca. It would get too confusing if the characters are transporting to some island in One Piece. Not that I have anything against One Piece nor is there really a need to put this rule down but I just have to put it out there.

2. Sex is allowed. F/F, F/M and M/M are all allowed.

3. Gore is not allowed. Death is. Confusing but I have an out there example that, ugh, I saw on the internet that I’ll tell in a sec. Death is allowed and characters bleeding out, getting bullet holes through the chest, or detailed digestion in a stomach, breast, or penis, is fine. What is not fine is fucking a severed head. Yeah, it exists out there. So, I’m taking a firm stance on that. But that is an example of what I wouldn’t allow.

4. Now, the question is what can the boys do? Well, the girls can have anything be done to them. The boys not so much but I will allow the boys to shrink (of course) and vore. After all, they are the ones who can do the cock vores. I get giddy at the thought of Uraraka curled up like a ball in Bakugou’s belly. Not that I ship them... ok, maybe 5% I do.

So, Boys can be shrunk, vore, and have sex. Girls can do anything.

October 2018 me no longer agrees with April 2018 me. Boys can have anything done to or by them like the girls.

5. Try to have at least two paragraphs for an entry. Two sentences for making more choices. I’ll look over your work to see if I can correct any mistakes, like spelling errors. If you mess something up and like to change a bit of it, email me. I’ll try my best notice anything and fix it. Or delete if it’s really bad. Though, I don’t think it’ll come to it.

6. At this point, you are probably asking is this just for porn. No, it doesn’t have to be. You can make a legitimate story. In fact, I encourage it! It is the reason I allow death.

7. Eri and characters like her... I’ll be watching to see if anyone goes too far. That being said, I don’t mind her handling tiny people and being naughty. Or same-size voring people or getting vored herself. It’s the normal sex part that I’m iffy about. It is the Internet and it’s just fiction... I haven’t made my mind up on that. I guess it’ll come down to the way it happens. Please email me your thoughts about this if you have any ideas.

Expansion Quirk
This quirk allows the user to expand or shrink any body part of themselves or anyone they touch.
The user expands the chosen body or body part, by taking in air molecules and transforming them into the need atomic matter to fill the gap that are made when they stretch out the space between particles.
The user can shrink himself to up to a 100th of their current size by condensing particles within their body, this allows them to move quicker but also be able to punch as if they were their original size. The user can also shrink others just by touching them and expand their bodies or body part as long as they are within.
(These details were thought up, and written by, Slime-J. A fellow writer on Writing.com.)

Note:
Since the series is still going, there will be more names coming later on. So we need the more option open for more characters coming in the future.

Is.. that all? I hope so. I don’t want to impose too many rules that could restrict creativity. If something more needs to be addressed, I’ll edit this page.

Now, why are you still here? Go on. You don’t want to miss your first day at Hero Academia, now do you?

Personal pride

May/15/2018
Yes! The My Hero Academia: Expansion Quirk has reached to 2,000 views! Thank you for your curiosity. I hope you continue to enjoy this interactive! It is currently at 33 entires, all had been made by me, and will continue to get bigger.

August/15/2018
Hooray! My Hero Academia: Expansion Quirk has reach to 7,072 views! Again, thank you very much for your curiosity. I have far more content now than I did three months ago. 66 entires. Most of them I made but I did have two others make some chapters too. Which I very much enjoyed having. I wonder what future chapters will hold.
